name: HB Tag&Score deck
description:
This is my version of Db0s' custom biotics deck. The initial idea goes to him, I just added my personal ideas and it is still untested. I'll keep you posted how well it performs.

And again, Kudos to Db0!

name: The Powerful Mac Five
description: This is the latest version of the Kate deck that I used to win Plugged-In San Rafael. It features a conventional Shaper endgame plus several tricks to keep the Corp honest. I'm currently testing several variants on this, but this is the baseline deck and IMO a good starting point for non-Atman Kate builds.

name: Versatile Whizzard
description:
The deck tries to win via two different routes: aggressive early runs without breakers (backed by Account Siphon/Vamp and Whizzard's innate trashing credits) and a quickly set-up deep dig on R&D with Djinn carrying two Mediums (preferably with counters from Grimoire), powered by Parasite (through Clone Chip) and Datasucker. This is also where Demolition Run and Stimhack come in.

Unless facing Weyland (where there is definitely still a 50 % chance of victory) this deck is brutal: massive economy (Siphon, Liberated, Kati, Sure Gamble & Stimhack) + Crypsis + precision strikes = success.

I've been playing this deck for around three months (at first in tag-me-style with Joshua B. and DLR and The Personal Touch for Crypsis for more focused runs) and it is highly disruptive to most Corp game-plans and just ruthless to HB/NBN asset-based economy (Whizzard makes this seem obvious, but Parasite/Clone Chip really pushes it to the next level).

name: Macgyver
description:
Built around my struggle against Jinteki, which everyone at my FLGS runs, with the goal to host Net Shield on an Omni-Drive. For the second Drive or if I'm not playing against Jinteki, I'll host a something like Femme on it so I can reuse the credit to skip over a Toll Booth or Data Raven for free. I try to install Datasucker early and gain tokens before installing Femme, then I can use them to make her more efficient.

Using Toolbox and/or Helpful AI to get out Underworld Contacts for clickless economy. Considering switching HAI with Rabbit Hole, though. Having 4 Link and Decoy's out has allowed me to walk through many sentries and avoid Scorched Earth more often.

The flexibility of Same Old Thing lets me either run more Maker's Eye runs or Infiltration, or if I get Levy AR Access early on I can trash it and still play it later in the game.

name: Haas-Bioroid - Version 1.0
description: New player. 2nd attempt at deck building. Looking for advice! I am currently limited to 1 core set at the moment.
